The law prohibits excluding children wit: existing conditions from private health insurance, effective six months following enactment.
The number of children affected by this: using a list of serious health conditions.
The analysis provides two estimates: one for outright denial of coverage and another for cases where the applicant might be offered a more expensive policy or one that excludes the pre-existing condition.
The film cherry: picks the higher end of the range, stating that "17 million kids can no longer be denied for a pre-existing condition," without providing the context of the broader estimate.
